radiographic_examinations.findings: Minimal dependent bibasilar atelectasis; no pleural or pericardial effusion; unremarkable liver, gallbladder, pancreas, spleen, and bilateral adrenal glands; tiny hypodensity within the spleen (2:17) too small to characterize; kidneys with symmetric enhancement and prompt contrast excretion; multiple tiny hypodensities bilaterally in the kidneys; a 13mm intermediate density lesion in the mid pole of the right kidney; appendix minimally dilated up to 7-8 mm with fluid in the tip and small amount of surrounding stranding; small amount of atherosclerotic calcification in aorta; no mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy; rectum, sigmoid colon, bladder, and prostate are unremarkable; no free fluid and no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy; no suspicious sclerotic or lytic lesions.
